[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Physician/Pharmacist System (PPS) defines secure authentication, structured UI navigation, patient record management, and prescription tracking requirements.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PPS ensures user authentication, patient data access, prescription tracking, and a structured, intuitive UI for physicians and pharmacists.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PPS integrates with authentication, patient management, and prescription tracking services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PPS provides a structured web-based and mobile UI for medical professionals.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PPS runs on cloud infrastructure optimized for desktops and tablets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PPS uses React.js frontend, Node.js backend, PostgreSQL for storage, and Redis caching.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PPS secures API transactions via TLS 1.3 encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PPS optimizes data retrieval for patient records and prescriptions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PPS manages authentication, prescription tracking, and structured UI navigation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PPS ensures accessibility, multi-device support, and real-time updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PPS connects to authentication, patient records, and prescription APIs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PPS enables secure login, patient record access, prescription tracking, and structured UI navigation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PPS is designed for physicians and pharmacists managing patient records and prescriptions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: PPS requires stable internet connectivity for real-time access and secure authentication.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PPS relies on encryption, cloud-hosted records, and structured UI.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Patient Records: Secure medical data storage.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall enforce authentication before granting access to patient data.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with patient databases for retrieving and updating records.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall require user login and display patient lists after authentication (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide structured navigation for patient records and prescriptions (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow physicians and pharmacists to add, delete, and update patient records (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a structured UI with readable fonts and easy navigation.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall retrieve patient information within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall maintain 99.5% uptime with ~4.38 hours per month downtime.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store patient data, prescription history, and user logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall provide structured navigation for records, prescriptions, and notes.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with healthcare data protection standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure authentication security, structured UI, and prescription tracking.

[SEC] 3. Verification: User authentication, patient record access, and structured navigation validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, security policies, and UI accessibility standards.
[SEC] 5. References: Healthcare data protection laws, UI/UX best practices, and authentication protocols.
